content.excerpt: Wall Street is in 'Nvidia chip war' mode. Elon Musk's xAI gets $7B chip leasing deal reshaping market dynamics.

sections.heading: Market Overview: Why is NVDA Moving?
sections.content: This isn't just a bounce. Apollo Global Management finalized $3.4B loan for Elon Musk's xAI to buy Nvidia chips - following last month's $3.5B deal, totaling $7B (~$9T KRW) 'chip sweepstakes'. Market sees this as Big Tech 'survival infrastructure war', not mere demand.

sections.heading: Recent Price Trends & Momentum
sections.content: Critical technical zone. Shares testing $188-190 neckline support after $212 peak correction. RSI at 44 signals oversold bounce potential. $185 hold creates double bottom for $210 retest. Volume exceeds 180M avg with bottom-fishing inflows.

sections.heading: Key Catalysts & Risk Factors
sections.content: Catalysts clear: Goldman Sachs holds $250 PT ahead of Feb 25 earnings, projecting 65% YoY datacenter growth. Risks exist: Executive $53M insider selling + Trump admin China export tightening pressures short-term.

sections.heading: Recent News & Developments
sections.content: Core driver: 'Apollo-xAI deal'. Apollo buys Nvidia chips, leases to xAI - guaranteed revenue 'honey contract' for Nvidia. Intel earnings relief eases sector rotation fears.

sections.heading: Institutional & Insider Activity
sections.content: Whales vs Insiders diverge. Goldman/UBS raise PTs to $235-250 recommending accumulation while insiders sold ~300K shares (no buys) past 30 days. Classic 'hands change' setup for retail shakeout + institutional Phase 2 rally.

sections.strategy: Scale in at $189. Set $185 stop-loss. Hold through earnings for upside capture.

faq.question: Too late to buy Nvidia now?
faq.answer: No. $188 support is technically attractive entry. xAI revenue impact not fully priced in.

faq.question: Feb 25 earnings outlook?
faq.answer: Datacenter revenue key. Consensus beat likely with upward guidance breaking prior highs.
